      Constructor and Description
      NioSslClient(java.lang.String protocol, java.lang.String remoteAddress, int port)
      Initiates the engine to run as a client using peer information, and allocates space for the buffers that will be used by the engine.

      Public method to send a message to the server.
      protected void write(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel socketChannel, javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine engine, byte[] message)
      Implements the write method that sends a message to the server the client is connected to, but should not be called by the user, since socket channel and engine are inner class' variables.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NioSslClient

        public NioSslClient(java.lang.String protocol,
                    java.lang.String remoteAddress,
                    int port)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Initiates the engine to run as a client using peer information, and allocates space for the buffers that will be used by the engine.
        Parameters:
        protocol - The SSL/TLS protocol to be used. Java 1.6 will only run with up to TLSv1 protocol. Java 1.7 or higher also supports TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 protocols.
        remoteAddress - The IP address of the peer.
        port - The peer's port that will be used.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Opens a socket channel to communicate with the configured server and tries to complete the handshake protocol.
        Returns:
        True if client established a connection with the server, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • write

        public void write(byte[] message)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Public method to send a message to the server.
        Parameters:
        message - - message to be sent to the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs to the socket channel.

      • write

        protected void write(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel socketChannel,
                     javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine engine,
                     byte[] message)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Implements the write method that sends a message to the server the client is connected to, but should not be called by the user, since socket channel and engine are inner class' variables. NioSslClient#write(String) should be called instead.
        Specified by:
        write in class NioSslPeer
        Parameters:
        message - - message to be sent to the server.
        engine - - the engine used for encryption/decryption of the data exchanged between the two peers.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs to the socket channel.

      • read

        public void read()
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Public method to try to read from the server.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • read

        protected void read(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel socketChannel,
                    javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine engine)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Will wait for response from the remote peer, until it actually gets something. Uses SocketChannel.read(ByteBuffer), which is non-blocking, and if it gets nothing from the peer, waits for waitToReadMillis and tries again.

        Just like read(SocketChannel, SSLEngine) it uses inner class' socket channel and engine and should not be used by the client. read() should be called instead.

        Specified by:
        read in class NioSslPeer
        Parameters:
        message - - message to be sent to the server.
        engine - - the engine used for encryption/decryption of the data exchanged between the two peers.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
              throws java.io.IOException
        Should be called when the client wants to explicitly close the connection to the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs to the socket channel.
